title: WORK ON DE-ENERGIZED ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT
fullText:
Work on de-energized electrical equipment shall only proceed if the electrical equipment is isolated and any adjacent exposed conductors or conductive parts in the work area are either â€”
(a) de-energized and isolated; or
(b) separated by barriers or a distance based on a risk assessment.
NOTE Clause 2.3.7 specifies the electrical work zone.
Figure 3.2 illustrates the requirements of this clause.
